Happy Birthday Dean! Ready to Play?
Lets Go!

Pols
Slaps
this is total number of questions you answered out of all questions
This is tha amount of pols you owe; 1 pol = 10 pushups
This is the total slaps you owe in our newly created slap bet

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Est ipsa laboriosam quasi sunt vel veritatis! Accusamus asperiores at, deserunt dolorem enim eum eveniet labore nihil omnis pariatur reprehenderit, sint tempora.Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Commodi debitis ex fugit magni molestiae optio totam! Dolore ea harum id, illo incidunt itaque iure minus nihil nobis odit sapiente, ut?
Pop Culture
Games
Quotes
Historical Figures
Inventions
Math Problems
Computer Science
Geography
Songs and Music
Sports
Classical Books
Guy\'s Favorites
Wildlife
$ SOUS Q.W.E.R.T.Y
A box without hinges, key or lid. Yet golden treasure inside is hid
Coal in my belly, Steel on my feet; When I get hot, it\'s time to eat
I come in different sizes, but am always exactly 1 foot long
Atari, PARC, NeXT, Pixar
Seek the white plaque in thy dwelling
Seven in a row to earn my wealth, but make me dirty and only half shall I pay
I have water put in me, but I am not a bath. I am often seen on Valentines day but I am not a box
I am the keeper of that which is rarely needed, I hold what you desire for future use
Go back in time to the day you were born, there I lie next to many more
To keep your notes at eye level, simply stab we with the pin\'s navel
Bright like diamond, hard like rock; You like me most when I am in a block
Enter clue for poster
Enter clue for car
The first film of what history-defining movie franchise was released in 1977?
Star Wars
George Lucas accepted a lower salary in exchange for full merchandising rights. \n Most thought he was a fool - boy, were they wrong!
What fictional character popularized the term "Friend-Zone"?
Joey Tribbiani
Matt le Blanc only had 11 dollars to his name when he got the role of Joey!
This story of this man made behemoth which never survived its maiden voyage was made into one of the best movies of all time
Titanic

While there were many faults in the founding(when a ship sinks) of the R.M.S. Titanic (which took a few hours from the collision), even after the fact most of the life boats were carrying less than half of the amount of passengers able to fit in the boat, and they refused to turn around and help those floating in the ocean (eventually even most of these people died of hypothermia)
This popular LOTR character dies in a different time and place in the movies compared to the books. \n (Hint: Sharkey)
Saruman

In the books he dies much later in the reckoning of the shire. Aside from this there are many more fantastic additions in the books that didn\'t make it to the movies like many more songs, poems and the great Tom Bambadil (but I\'ll let you figure it out for yourself)
This famous school divides its students into 4 unique houses by the command of a hat
Hogwarts
All the movies combined total just shy of 20 hours (1,178 minutes) which makes it perfect for a full day 24-Hour marathon :)
In {name of a great, mind-bending movie} what is the name of the objects used to determine if one is dreaming?
Totem
Inception is my favorite movie of all time and I have watched it 6 times to this day!
What animal is revealed to be running the world and causes the main characters of the TV show to flee to a new dimension?
Squirrel
Justin Roiland actually gets drunk {Buuurp} in real life sometimes {Buurp} in order to voice Rick! {Buuurp}
This cute, lovable, fictional character was created in 1974 and celebrates her birthday on November 1st
Hello Kitty
The Hello Kitty franchise has generated an estimated 86 Billion dollars!!! but it is still only in 2nd place; can you guess what is first?
The highest grossing movie in the most successful movie franchise of all time
Avengers: Endgame
The MCU has grossed over 18 BILLION dollars to date with Endgame accounting for about 2.8 billion.
What is the name of the character for which the actor won the only Best Supporting Actor oscar given posthumously(after his death)?
Joker
Heath Ledger got into the role of Joker by locking himself in a secluded hotel room for 6 weeks while filling an eerie journal throughout his stay
What is the very first pokemon to be designed?
Rhydon
How many guesses did you make before looking it up? If less than 5 than I am dissappointed!
What contest took place in the following cities: Cologne, Seattle, Vancouver, Shanghai?
The International
TI9 had a prize pool of over 34 million dollars making it the highest esports prize (so far) by a landslide.
What famous video game, created by Atari, was released in 1972?
Pong
Contrary to what many might think, Pong is not the first video game made. That title belongs to Spacewars
Playing Card
Playing Cards were invented during the Tang Dynasty in China almost 1200! years ago.
Who is the twin brother of the plumber who is tasked with rescuing a princess from a castle?
Luigi
Mario was named after a landlord who interrupted a nintendo company meeting demanding overdue rent.
What is the full name of the sidekick of most famous hedgehog in the world?
Miles Prower
Miles Prower (or more commonly known as tails) is a pun on Miles Per Hour :) get it? - because Sonic is so fast
This arcade game has both a male version and a female counterpart.
Pac-Man
Originally the game was called Puck-Man! Can you imagine playing Puck-man.
In this popular game released in 2007 the player has to teleport its character and objects in order to solve puzzles
Portal
GLaDOS stands for Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System
In which game do players have to try to score points by rolling 5 dice to create certain combanations?
Yahtzee
Did you guess Generala?, in fact there are several games similar to Yahtzee including "poker dice" and "Jacy-Tacy"
What game starts up after typing the following command: "emacs -batch -l dunnet" (*in an emacs editor)
Dunnet
While this terrific adventure game can only be played on Mac and Linux, games such as sudoku, pac-man, 2048 and more! can be played on the windows command prompt
"{blank}, Sweat and Respect. The first two you give, the last one you earn."
Blood

Dwayne Johnson initially wanted to become a football player but after suffering injury he had to find a new path. He cites this in many of his speeches stating that he started with only 7 dollars after being kicked from the CFL(Canadian Football League).
"Hatred is never ended by hatred but by {blank}."
Love

Buddha. "The Buddha" was a wealthy prince that decided leave his comfortable life to endure suffering. when he wasn\'t fulfilled by suffering he decided to sit under a tree for months until he discovered a meaning for life. The rest is history.
"A drop of {blank} catches more flies than a gallon of gall
Honey
If you want something you\'ve never {blank}, you must be willing to do something you\'ve never {blank}."
Had, Done
Thomas Jefferson. Self-Explanatory
"Sometimes life hits you in the head with a {blank}. Don\'t lose faith."
Brick
Steve Jobs, given during his famous commencement speech at Stanford. !MUST hear!
"The secret of getting ahead is {blank} {blank}."
Getting, Started
Mark Twain. Author, best known for The adventures of Tom Sawyer and Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
"Nothing in life is as {blank} as you think it is when you are thinking about it."
Important
Daniel Kahneman - born in Israel! From the book "Thinking fast and slow". Read it at least twice
"We know what we {blank}, but know not what we may {blank}."
Are, Be
William Shakespeare. My favorite shakespeare quote along with "A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool."
"No one is {blank} in this world who lightens the burden of it to anyone else."
Useless

Charles Dickens. He never attended school for more than 4 years and he worked in rat-infested warehouse as a teen. He submitted countless stories for months, all of which failed until one was finally accepted. The rest.. well you know
"If you don't find the {blank}, if you don't do the {blank}, you don't get the results."
Time, Work
Arnold Schwarzenegger. I urge you to look up some of his motivational speeches or read the book if you fancy.
Most notably known for his famous speech given on August 1963, name this civil rights activist born 1929, assassinated on 1968.
Martin Luther King
Just go see/hear/read the speech if you haven\'t done so in school; Please.
Who is this founding father which, aside from his historical work on electrivity, was also writer, philosopher, inventor, politician and even more?!
Benjamin Franklin

Franklin is credited with the invention of the lightning rod, after his famous experiment of flying a kite through a storm to prove that lightning is electricity (by conducting elextricity from the clouds to the kite and back down to the ground)!
What triumphant military leader during the early 19th century is credited with bringing liberal reforms throughout Europe?
Napoleon Bonaparte
While the famous phrase "Liberté, égalité, fraternité" was concieved during the French Revolution; it was first said in 1790, well before Napoleon rose to power
This prominent german scientist who is credited with countless contributions (and a nobel prize to go along with it), was declines an offer to become Israel\'s 2nd President
Albert Einstein

He never actually failed math (was at the top of his class), rather left school at 15 after mastering calculus! While he was against the use of the Atomic Bombs, he is probably the main reasons the Americans knew of its possibility
Who was the first computer programmer?
Ada Lovelace
All the way back in the 1830\'s! She used punch cards in order to put input and receive output from a machine. (Do you even know what a punch card is? :)
Who is considered as the Father of Philosophy?
Socrates
Born 2500 years ago, named after him is the Socrates Method (which you use constantly: look it up!). My favorite quote of his: "There is only one thing I know, and that is that I know nothing."
Who is credited with the most eminent set of 3 laws in history>
Isaac Newton
While the apple didn\'t exactly fall on his head, the apple tree did exist, and it still grows apples to this day at his old house in England.
Who was the person after which the worldwide used Gregorian calendar counts its years?
Jesus
BC (before christ), AD (anno domini). There is no 0 rahter 1 BC -> 1 AD. The counting starts after his birth, i.e. AD does not mean After Death of Jesus (who only lived about 30 years)
The youngest person to win a Nobel Peace Prize, born on July 12, 1997!
Malala Yousafzai
Women\'s rights activist who was shot point blank in the head for speaking out (and survived). Yes she is younger than me, but definitely a part of history already.(What have I done with my life ;)
This pilot disappeared somewhere over the pacific while trying to become the first person to circumnavigate the globe
Amelia Earhart
First female to fly alone across the atlantic. To this day her plane wreckage has not been found and her disappearance is still a mystery.
Wilbur and Orville invented which contraption in 1903?
Airplane

A man named Samuel Langley, renowned scientist and professor, was given government funding and a choice of top engineers to invent the airplane; yet the Wright brothers, who never even attended college, beat him to it. (See TED talk by Simon Sinek)
Created by Bill Gates and Paul Allen, Altair BASIC was the first programming language for what invention?
Personal Computer

As 2 college students they had no access to the computer itself (Altair 8080) yet they managed to make the program work on their first try (in fact, Paul Allen finished the code on the plane before the test)!
Credited to Henry Ford (of Ford Motors) what technique revolutionized the Industrial Era and is still just as effective to this day?
Assembly Line
*Contrary to common knowledge, he didn\'t actually invent this method! "Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason why so few engage in it."
While he did not invent it, Thomas Edison made what invention practical and paved the way for its future?
Light Bulb
By the time of his death, Edison patented over 1000 inventions, most notably including the microphone, phonograph(ask Chen ;]) and many more.
This device heats and cooks food by exposing it to electromagnetic radiation
Microwave
Invented during WW2, the microwave oven came to be by accident when its inventor realized a chocolate bar in his pocket began to melt after being exposed to microwave radiation (hence the name)
While more of a discovery than an invention, what is comprised of heat, fuel and oxygen?
Fire
While the earliest known control of fire was over 400,000 years ago; it is believed that fire was first discovered as far back as 1.7 million years ago
While today\'s Information Age can be credited to the invention of the transistor, what creation is responsible for making this information available to Billions of people worldwide?
Internet
Over 50% of the global population uses the internet as of this day, encompassing about 4.5 billion people
Credited with developments such as Ethernet, Laser Printing, OOP and much more; Xerox Parc reimagined what device used to navigate the first ever Graphical User Interface?
Mouse
First made popular with the release of the Macintosh in 1984, the mouse got its name from its appearence, resembling the animal with the cord acting as the tail
The invention of what powerful tool can be referred to as Röntgen radiation?
X-Ray
Initially discovered by accident while experimenting with electrical currents, it was dubbed X-radiation for its unEXplained nature.
What invention is used in the phrase: "Even a broken {blank} is right twice a day"?
Clock
While measuring time can be dated as far back as 2000 B.C. the modern quartz watches ( note diff between clock and watch) used today were only invented in the late 1960\'s

Regarded as one of the most beautiful equations, Euler\'s formula combines some of the most common mathematical values in a simple equation. (See 3Blue1Brown on youtube for easy to understand explanation of this)
A bat and ball cost 1.10$. The bat costs one dollar more than the ball. How much does the ball cost?

Did you guess incorrectly on your first try? In fact most people often guess 0.10 and this is because of how the mind works, it tries to conceive an answer based on the words automatically before engaging the thinking part of your brain that actually produces the answer.
Did you forget PEMDAS? Always think before answering, one day it will actually have a big impact.

This comes down to simple defenitions - A factorial is the number of combinations possible with numbers less than or equal to that number, and with 0 there is still one possible combination - no combination at all!
What is the 10th element of the The Fibonacci Sequence?
Often referred to as the magical sequence since it appears unexpectedly, Fibonacci discovered it when trying to determine the growth of the rabbit population.
What greek letter is often used in math to denote a very small number that is not negative, approaching zero but staying positive?
Epsilon
(ε), While the letter itself has more meanings in different conotations, this one is the most popular and is mostly used in Calculus
What is the name of the tool used to calculate the area under a curve/graph? (NOT a proper mathematical definition)
Integral
While you will become best friends with these creatures(Integrals) soon enough, for now just know that integrals are the tools used to calculate properties of many 3D shapes
How many prime numbers exist?
Infinite
Surprised? It has been proven in different ways that there are an infinite number of prime numbers!
What is the name of the coordinate system we most commonly use to display graphs?
Cartesian
Another one you might have seen in Physics is the Polar system - using (r, θ).
for n=1,2,3,...,99 what is the sum of: [1/n - 1/(n+1)] (add one to {n} after each calculation until you reach 99)
How many elements did you calculate before realizing the pattern? This is called a telescopic sum.
In Python, what is the value of X after this code is executed: X = ((((2 ** 5) % 2) + 1) // 2)
In python (and many more programming languages) {%} = remainder, {//} = integer division (only whole numbers)
Using a very complicated computer machine, what code did Alan Turing crack during WW2?
Enigma
The highest award one can get in the Computer Science field is called the "Turing Award" and is referred to as the Nobel Prize for Computing
While everyone knows Steve Jobs as the force behind Apple Computer\'s success, what is the name of the computer engineer who actually designed and built the first Apple computer?
Steve Wozniak
Even though he stepped down (left by his own wil) the company in 1985, he is still listed as an Apple employee to this day.
What is the used computer operating system in the world today? (By number of devices running it)
Android
Did you guess Windows? There are actually more mobile devices in the world today than Desktops, Laptops and Tablets combined!
What is the most valuable Technology company in the world as of December 2019?
Microsoft

While falling just shy of most valuable company in the world (at number 2) it surpassed Apple and even Amazon (which held the title briefly during the first part of 2019). Believe it or not, most of their revenue actually comes from Cloud Services
In what programming language is the following code written in? MOV AL, 61h
Assembly
(Closest human readable code to what the computer actually interprets) This is then changed to 1\'s and 0\'s by the Assembler which is what the computer understands
In computers an image is represented as a matrix where each element is a {blank}?
Pixels
Everything to do with images like Image Recognition, Image filters, Image/Video Compression use linear algebra(more on that after high school :) to perform mentioned functions.
If 8 bits (1 bit = 1 or 0) equal 1 byte, how many bits are in 1 Gigabyte
What this means is that if order to have 1 Gigabyte of memory you need that amount of 1\'s and 0\'s to represent all the data
The recently announced GitHub Archive Program will store (later this year) every public repository in which city?
Svalbard
That\'s right, Every single public program will be kept in the Arctic World Archive vault in Norway for 1000 years! Including this very APP :)
What is the main programming language used to develop android applications?
Java
There are more programs with different languages that enable you to create applications, but as of right now the most common is Java with Kotlin slowly catching up
Which country is often, incorrectly, left out of world maps/globes?
New Zealand
Funnily enough this is more common than you might think occuring even in games like Risk, many posters and even in the UN!
Nessie, the famous Loch Ness monster, resides in which country?
Scotland
A recent scientific publishing, which collected DNA samples from Loch Ness, showed that Nessie is most likely an eel
In what city does the Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) begin at?
London
While sometimes used as a synonym to UTC they are in fact no entirely the same and can differ by up to 0.9s.
What is the smallest country in the world, based on area?
Vatican City
It did not become an independent conutry until 1929. The country itself is slightly bigger than Disneyland.
Once believed to be the edge of the world, in what city is Land\'s End located?
Cornwall
One of the more stunning views I have had the privilege to see, come to me if you want to see pictures :)
The Niagara Falls are known to be seperated between which two countries?
USA, Canada
It is comprised of 3 distinct waterfalls. While neither are the world\'s highest waterfall, they do consist of the fastest-moving waterfall in the world
What is the capital of Australia?
Canberra
Did you guess Sydney/Melbourne? Everyone does at first. This is one of the most popular "pub quiz" questions, so best you know the answer now :)
Between which 2 countries is the highest mountain in the world located? (answer in alphabetical order)
Nepal, Tibet

While being the tallest and most famous mountain it is actually not close to being the deadliest (regarding percentage of people who end up dying trying to climb it, not total number), that title belongs to Annapurna (another mountain in the same region)
What is the world\'s youngest country?
South Sudan

Established on July 9, 2011 it is only 8 years old! In fact since 2004 four new countries have emerged: Serbia and Montenegro (which used to Yugoslavia) and Kosovo which used to be split between Serbia and Montenegro :)
Long, long ago when, according to scientific evidence and discovery, almost the entire world was one giant land mass. What was it called?
Pangea
This is the main reason why many of the same land based animals exist in different continents, even though they have no way of crossing the oceans!
What timeless alternative-rock song was originally written for a movie starring Nicolas Cage about a man willing to give up immortality for love?
Iris
In the original version of the song 5/6 guitar strings are tuned to D in contrast to almost all of the famous pop/rock songs nowadays which use the standard EBGDAE tuning.
What talented musician, and a member of the Rock and Roll Hall of fame, played drums for the legendary Nirvana and later formed the Foo Fighters?
Dave Grohl
Dave Grohl plays many instruments including Drums, Guitar, Bass and even the Keyboard. He once recorded an entire album by himself, playing all of the instruments in the songs, as well as singing!
"You may say I\'m a dreamer, but I\'m not the only one" is part of what revolutionary song?
Imagine
John Lennon released this song during his solo career (after the Beatles), and his wife Yoko Ono is credited with a lot of its contents.
What is the most known song in the entire world, which has been translated to just about every single language?
Happy Birthday
Originally composed in the late 19th century, Happy Birthday was actually copyrighted in Europe until 2017!
Dave Mustaine is the co-founder, vocalist and lead guitarist of the wildly successful heavy metal band Megadeth. What band did he originally play guitar for, before being kicked out abruptly?
Metallica

Even though he went on to have a very successful career, he has stated that he feels like a failure because, driven by vengeance, he vowed to become more successful than Metallica after he was kicked, but that never happened.
What composer wrote the timeless classic "Eine Kleine Nacht-Musik"? (Even if this looks gibberish try to venture a guess)
Mozart
It is roughly translated to "a little night music" and probably his most recognised work. Bonus: Beethoven was just 15 years younger than Mozart and many of his works are influenced by him
Born in Missouri; what is the name of the one and only Slim Shady (or one half of Bad Meets Evil)
Marshall Mathers
Did you guess Eminem? :) Aside from being labled one of the top 100 greatest artists of all time, he also has an oscar to his name for Best Original Song in "Lose Yourself"
Who is the only musician to be inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame 3 times?
Eric Clapton

While most known for songs from his later solo career such as "Layla", "Tears in Heaven" and "Wonderful Tonight" nowadays; He began with "The Yardbirds" which famously also included Jimmy Page and Jeff Beck, who along with Clpaton are hailed to belong to the top 10 guitarists of all time
Born in Australia, Tommy Emmanuel is a master of what instrument?
Acoustic Guitar

Using complex fingerstyle techniques and percussive use of the guitar he is able to be a "one man band" (see his TED talk). His works are jaw-dropping and I urge you to listen to a few and even have them in the background when studying since they are instrumental and thus not a distraction
What is the first ever single released by multiple-grammy winning artist Bruno Mars?
Just The Way You Are

This song comes from the album "Doo-Wops and Hooligans" (Doo-wops for the girls and hooligans for the boys). Bonus: The hooligans is then name of the band that Bruno Mars travels with and appear in his music videos.
Who won the first ever Fifa World Cup, which it also hosted?
Uruguay
The finals match against Argentina, was and is to this day the only World Cup match not played on the weekend (Wednesday)
What is the name of New Zealand\'s international sports team? (For the country\'s national sport
All Blacks
Their Emblem is the Silver Fern (A unique plant that only grows in NZ and is characterised by the silver color of the under-surface of its leaves)
What ancient martial art form will make its olympic debut in the 2020 Tokyo Games?
Karate
Along with Surfing, Skateboarding, Sport Climbing and Baseball/Softball Karate will make its first appearance as an olympic sport
What televised sports event holds the record for most expensive advertisement slot? (Within a single country)
Super Bowl
In fact, for the 2020 Super Bowl a 30-second ad slot costs as much as 5.6 Million Dollars! No wonder the ads are the real highlight of the game.
Being only invented in 1891 what sport was originally created to keep athletes indoors during the winter?
Basketball
Some sports such as Soccer, Wrestling, Golf, Rugby date back thousands of years while the likes of Football, Basketball, Baseball have existed for less than 200 years.
While most people are familiar with Horse Racing or Dog Racing, what other animal is popular with racing mostly in the arab countries and Australia?
Camel
Yes Camel Racing is a thing! In fact camels can reach speeds of up to 65 Km/h
The popular phrase "En garde!" is derived from what sport?
Fencing
Meaning to assume the on-guard position in fencing this is a part of "En garde! Prêts? Allez!" which vaguely translates to "On your mark - ready - go"
Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr. is the birth name of what late sports figure?
Muhammad Ali
Considered by some as the greatest athlete of the 20th Century, aside from his many feats, Ali was involved in several boxing matches which attracted over a Billion viewers (A record at the time)
Out of the top 5 Association Football leagues in the world, which club holds the record for most league championships?
Juventus
With 35 Serie-A victories they hold the throne, with Real Madrid coming in second at 33. If considering all achieved titles, Barcelona holds that title with 95 trophies
What is the name of the sport in which contestants must train their bird-of-prey to hunt animals in the wild?
Falconry
This sport can be dated back almost 3000 years and was once the "Sport of Kings". Also it is super cool :)
What book is described as a dystopian novel that allegorizes the story of schoolboys marooned on an island to investigate mankind\’s inherent savagery
Lord Of The Flies
Aside from being one of my favorite books, it has the best, most profound last sentence of any book I have ever read (Big Spoiler Warning!)
What Nobel Prize winning American Author is known for the novels: "A Farewell to Arms" , "For Whom the Bell Tolls", "The Old Man and the Sea"?
Ernest Hemingway
"The Old Man and the Sea" is based on Hemingway\'s experiences when living in Cuba
Written by James Joyce, and considered by many to be the best novel of all time (or at least the 20th century), what is the name of his creation?
Ulysses

This book is divided into 18 Episodes which are based on Homer\'s poem Odyssey (2nd oldest piece of literature ever). In addition it is regarded of one of the most difficult books to read (if not THE most) in the English language.
What is the name of the infamous creature which Captain Ahab has sworn to kill?
Moby Dick

While Moby Dick is fictional, he was inspired by a real life sperm whale named Mocha Dick. In addition The Pequod (ship in the book) was loosely based on a real whaling ship from the 19th century - The Essex
Most recognised for his TV adaptation, what lovable yellow teddy-bear originally appeared in a book published in 1926? (Alongside his friends Piglet and Eeyore)
Winnie-The-Pooh
Christopher Robin (The boy character in Winnie-The-Pooh) was named after the author\'s son who had a real life teddy bear named, .. Winnie the pooh :)
What is the name of the well known ship in Jules Verne\'s timeless classic "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea"
Nautilus
The description of the Nautilus in the book closely resemble the appearence of present day submarines even though the book was written over 150 years ago!
What critically acclaimed book explores the themes of Government Surveillance and Totalitarianism (Government that permits no freedom and strikes down on opposition)?
The term "Big Brother" which is commonly used in pop-culture is actually a character in the book. Bonus: Apple\'s legendary ad for The Macintosh in 1984 is based on this book!
What epic play can be described as a tale of two young lovers that are forbidden to be together, and end up taking their own lives out of the pain of their separation?
Romeo and Juliet
While this is not a book, rather a play it is a must know piece of literature contrived almost 500 years ago!
Middle Earth is the setting of what author\'s classic fictional novels?
J.R.R. Tolkein
Tolkein actually conceived and developed many languages for his works, most notably the Elvish Language which is also the most comprehensive and is built up of different dialects.
Alonso Quixano is the name of which famous character in this classical novel bearing the same name?
Don Quixote
Written all the way back in the beginnings of the 1600\'s this book is labeled as the first ever modern novel which paved the way for all future works of literature
This apex predator of the ocean belongs, despite their misleading name, to the dolphin family.
Orca
Killer Whales have a diverse diet consisting of fish, penguins, seals, sea-lions and even whales! They are a very social and usually hunt in large pods.
The Great Migration is the astounding trek of 1.5 million of what animal across the Serengti in search of water?
Wildebeest
This phenomenon has been well documented and filmed, showing the perilous journey of this species showing the true meaning of strength in numbers.
Aside from the Echidnas what is the only other extant monotreme species (mammal that lays eggs)?
Platypus
They have been described as egg-laying, duck-billed, beaver-tailed, otter-footed which caused scientists to believe it was a fake! Aside from that the male is also a venomous mammal.
What animal is responsible for the mose human deaths per year?
Mosquitoes
While perhaps not that surprising they are responsible for roughly 700,000 human deaths per year. Coming in second is, you might have guessed, humans, 3rd - Snakes and 4th - Dogs
What species of bear is the only one to be classified as a marine mammal?
Polar Bears
They spend over 50% of their life hunting for food, with an abysmal hunting success rate of less than 2%. They are not endangered, rather labeled Vulnerable.
What animal is considered to be the closest human relative?
Chimpanzee
Yes, Bonobos could also be correct. In fact together with Orangutans and Gorillas these 4 species make up what is known as "Great Apes" which are the closest primates to humans.
A common misconception is that a peacock refers to both genders of the species. What is the female actually called?
Peahen
The extravagant, colorful tail of feathers we see on these animals are unique to the peacock and are used as a part of a courtship ritual to attract the Peahens.
Sometimes called the "Unicorn of the Sea", what is the name of this "tusk" bearing whale?
Narwhal
Narwhals or Narwhales are most closely related to the beluga whales which are the real "white whales" of the ocean. (*Though Moby Dick was a sperm whale not a beluga whale)
What is the fastest species in the animal kingdom? (Including running, swimming, flying or whatever you can conjure)
Peregrine Falcon

Reaching over 320 Km/h while diving from high above during their hunts, these birds-of-prey hold this grand title. In fact they are also used in falconry and some breathtaking videos of this speed in action have been shown live.
The internationally known spanish fiesta dance is based off of the movements of what animal?
Flamingo
The flamingos are actually white colored birds, and they get their pink colorings from the food they eat. (Ever noticed that shrimp turns pick after it is cooked..?)
In what book does the phrase "A man convinced against his will is of the same opinion still."?
How to Win Friends and Influence People
This self-help book was originally a companion textbook for the course of the same name offered by Dale Carnegie and is now one of the best selling books of all time.
Often cited as "Brain Orgasm" what is the name of the phenomenon where one feels a tingly sensation down the back of his neck and upper spine?
ASMR

While relatively little is known about the causes of this, results have shown that it can be triggered by all kinds of Sounds or Visual movements which differ from person to person. Not all are fortunate enough to be able to experience ASMR.
Aside from the triceps what primary muscle does the common push-up exercise train?
Pectoralis Major

Because of the size and structure of the Pec Major it is recommended to train at different angles and movements to maximize usage of the muscle fiber and maximise amount of damage inflicted ont the muscle to stimulate growth.
Beginning as an actress but later becoming a model, women\'s rights activist and even a UN Ambassador, who is this "Queen" I am referring to?
Emma Watson

Even though she stated that after Harry Potter she would never have to work for money in her life, she still finished her Bachelor\'s degree in English Literature and worked hard to launch the HeForShe campaign for gender equality. Queen Indeed!
You might have heard of the Speckled Band, notably being one of the best Sherlock Holmes stories. In the story, what does the speckled band turn out to be?
Snake
Sorry for the spoiler ;), but there are many more invigorating tales of these two detectives. (You can find a small collection in my room)
In what form are the carbohydrates you consume stored in your muscles?
Glycogen

Glycogen is essentially the fuel for our muscles which when had at proper levels (meaning consumed enough proper carbs) leads to better performance of the muscle which in turn leads to more hypertrophy
What is the official bird of the city of Liverpool?
Liver Bird
Aside from appearing on the symbol of the city\'s football club, 2 statues of the bird stand high atop the Royal Liver Building overlooking Mersey and the gorgeous pier.
Udacity, EdX, Coursera, MIT Open Coursewarea and Udemy are all examples of platforms offering what?
MOOC

MOOC - Massive Open Online Courses, have taken the world by storm over roughly the past decade for their ability to bring massive amounts of high level education to the entire world. My 2 favorites (Aside from Mobile Development): MIT 6.00.1x and CS50!
What is the name of the famous poem by Valeri Cox about how oblivious we can sometimes be to our mistakes.
The Cookie Thief

Currently my favorite poem, which I have come across not too long ago in a fascinating TED talk. I urge to at least hear the part where the speaker recites the poem since it is a different experience than simply reading it.
"White lips, Pale face. Breathing in Snowflakes" is the beginning of my favorite song written by which Singer/Songwriter?
Ed Sheeran
